place.name: WYSALL
place.gazetteerText: WYSALL, a parish, with a village, in the district of Loughborough and county of Nottingham; 6 miles NE of Loughborough r. station. It has a post-office under Nottingham. Acres, 1,360. Real property, £2,091. Pop., 274. Houses, 69. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £123.* Patron, Sir H. Bromley, Bart. The church has a tower and spire. There are Baptist and Wesleyan chapels, a parochial school, and charities £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
